raw_comment:
The first thing that I notice is that young women tend to reach out more compared to young men across all categories. I also noticed that as ease of communication increases (i.e less effort/time), the percentage of young people who reach out grows.

One thing I wonder is the why the disparities between the genders exist. 

This relates to me, as I always try to contact my parents on a frequent basis via text and face time. Many college students are out of state, so it is likely we do not get to see our parents that much

A title could be "Parental communication: disconnecting to connect"
ace_sentences: Young women tend to reach out more than young men across all categories.
The ease of communication can increase.
If the ease of communication increases, then the effort decreases.
If the ease of communication increases, then the time decreases.
If the ease of communication increases, then the percentage of young people who reach out increases.
I wonder why disparities between genders exist.
I try to contact my parents frequently.
I contact my parents via text.
I contact my parents via FaceTime.
Many college students are out of state.
If a college student is out of state, then the college student does not see the parents often.
A title could be "Parental communication: disconnecting to connect".
